pathAssistantSteps.info: The Ad Ops Team should be vetting all inputs to the brief to ensure we have everything needed for execution.
If a campaign has been cancelled please comment the reason for cancellation.
If a campaign has been deactivated before expected end date, please comment the reason for deactivation.

- At this stage, the campaign has been QA'd in the app and metrics have been checked.

- See the "Campaign QA Checklist for Operators" wiki resource in the Ad Ops Wiki for more information.

- If any errors are found, please add them to the "Post-Live QA Number of Errors Found" and "Post-Live QA Bulleted Errors" fields.

Audit DRI should review all fields listed in the “Pre-Live Audit Review” tab in the Ad Ops Project Resources.


Audit DRI will provide feedback by adding the number of fixes and the description of each fix to the "Pre-Live Number of Errors Found" and "Pre-Live Bulleted Fixes" fields.

If the Audit DRI has feedback/edits/questions, it will be called out in "Pre-Live Bulleted Fixes" and tag the Campaign DRI to make adjustments to the campaign. 


The Campaign DRI inform Audit DRI that the edits/questions are addressed. 


The Audit DRI will review the campaign once more before moving the brief item forward to ‘Scheduled Live’.

At this stage, the campaign is scheduled to go live and is awaiting live QA, which should happen on the first business day a campaign is live and cover the following:

-Metrics

-Testing in-app

-Testing on desktop

See the "Campaign QA Checklist for Operators" wiki resource in the Ad Ops Wiki for more information.

During this stage, the team should cross-check the contract against the campaign to ensure the fields listed in the Ad Ops Project Resources sheet within the Contract and Campaign Review tab. If edits are needed, in the comment section, please tag the Campaign DRI and provide any feedback/edits needed. Then fill out the "Testing QA Fixes Needed" field.

During this stage, the tester will review the campaign in-app using the “Testing - In-App Review” process listed in the Ad Ops Project Resources.


If edits are needed, in the comment section, please tag the Campaign DRI and provide any feedback/edits needed. Then add them to the "Testing QA Fixes Needed" field. 


If no edits needed, the Testing DRI will confirm that the QA is complete with no flags to the Campaign DRI and change the status to “Testing - Ready to Schedule Live”.
During this stage, the brief item must have an assigned tester (either self-assigned or assigned by Campaign DRI) to review the campaign.

If the Testing DRI has discovered some edits, review the following:


  1. Edits have been flagged in the “Testing QA Fixes Needed” field towards the bottom of the brief item and in the comment section. 
  2. The Campaign DRI will make those adjustments. 
  3. Once those adjustments are made, the brief item must go through a second round of testing. 
  4. Campaign DRI will change the brief status to “Testing - Second Review”.

Once the campaign(s) have passed the testing stages, the Campaign DRI will set the campaign live by adjusting the following in Campaign Manager:

  • If Promotion/Banners: 
    • Start Date
    • Audience
    • Campaign-Level Scheduling/Dayparting (if applicable) 
    • Banner Scheduling/Dayparting (if applicable) 
    • Frequency Capping (if applicable) 
    • Banner Priority 
  • If Sponsored Listings:
    • Toggle campaign Active at the General and Ad Group levels

During the Testing-Second Review, the Testing DRI will test the campaign one more ensuring that the previously requested edits have been addressed. 


  1. Once the campaign has passed the second round of edits, the Testing DRI will move the brief item to “Testing - Ready to Schedule Live” and let the campaign DRI know that the campaign is Ready to Schedule Live. 
  2. If there were more edits that needed to be made after the second review, the Testing DRI will add on to the feedback/callouts in the "Testing QA Fixes Needed" field and tag the campaign DRI for another round of edits, and change the status back to “Testing - Ready for Edits”.

This item must be shifted to "Campaign Building" in order for the Ad Ops team to begin executing. Standard SLA is 1-2 weeks after shifting to "Campaign Building". See the "Campaign Creation Blockers resource" in the Ad Ops Wiki for more information.
